entry.title: The Greek Pavilion at the 14th Biennale
entry.content:
The Greek participation in the 14th International Architecture Exhibition - La Biennale di Venezia, is directed and curated by the National Commissioner architect and professor Yannis Aesopos, under the title “Tourism Landscapes: Remaking Greece”.

It explores the role of tourism as a vehicle of modernization of Greece through the emergence of constructed tourism landscapes: hotels and resorts, organized beaches, archaeological sites and museums, public space designs and infrastructure facilities. Moreover, it focuses on the concurrent (re)shaping of Greek national identity that is enhanced through the contact of the “other”, the foreign, new and global element, which the activity of tourism presupposes.

  • Customer: Ministry of Environment, Energy & Climate Change
  • Commissioner - Curator: Yannis Aesopos
  • Advisors: Elias Zenghelis, Georgios Panetsos, Lois Papadopoulos
  • Assistants: Maria Chassioti, Ioanna Koulouri, Georgios Kourakos, Mina Roussou, Thodoris Svoronos
  • Press & Communication: Angeliki Evripioti, Anais Evripioti
  • Photographers: Panos Kokkinias, Yiorgis Yerolympos
  • Construction: R.C.TECH

All images courtesy of the organizers. Used under permission.

entry.title: Royal Botania
entry.content:
We are excited to announce the beginning of our exclusive partnership with Royal Botania regarding its Outdoor Lighting Collection.

Royal Botania uses superior natural materials: premium Javanese plantation teak, granite, stainless steel, glass. When placed outside all the Royal Botania lighting models will integrate into their natural environment. Most of the lamps are designed to use energy-saving light bulbs with low energy consumption and LED.

entry.title: On the boards VII
entry.content:
The ultimate challenge for the involved in the lighting design process is the quick & reliable imaging of the ideas without the hassle of using sophisticated, expensive and time consuming software like 3dstudio, Rhino, Maya etc.

The first image on the left was produced by the humble Relux and its internal raytracer. It took just 3-4 hours, starting from scratch, to finish and most of the time spent on adjusting the raytracer settings. Of course it’s not the best result on planet earth but it’s ok for everyday’s work and surely captures the real atmosphere of the space. Have in mind that this certain case (indirect lighitng + artificial skylight) is tough enough for every lighting software.

entry.title: Ilioupolis, architecture & public space
entry.content:
“Ilioupolis, architecture and public space - The determination and application of the strong identity of Ilioupolis” is the title of the lecture by Christos Giannakos (Architect - Engineer, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Architectural Association Graduate Design Diploma), to be held on Saturday 11.01.2014 19:00 at the theater of Ilioupolis city hall.

The subject of the lecture is the definition of a strong central idea in Urban and Architectural Scale that will be a major tool of internal development for the city of Ilioupolis improving the living standards of its inhabitants. It is the result of three years of research and development (2010-2013).

An exhibition of physical models will run on Friday 10th (10:00-14:00, 17:00-22:00) and on Saturday 11th (17:00-19:00) in the foyer of the theater. Visitors will be welcomed to the lecture by the sounds of the music compilation “Linear Chromatics”.

The entrance is free to the public.
